intro: Pisum sativum subsp. asiaticum, commonly known as the Asian pea or Chinese pea, is a subspecies of the common pea plant. It is characterized by its small, edible pods that contain several seeds. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and produces flowers in shades of white or pink. It thrives in temperate climates and is often cultivated for its nutritional value. This subspecies is adapted to a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained, loamy soils.
